main event: Multiple unidentified flying objects (UFOs) were observed in Washington, D.C. on August 6, 1952. The reported sighting involved two discs the size of a fifth-cent piece, moving at jet speed towards Andrews AFB and then maintaining a constant course while circling.
interesting points: The reported discs were described as moving at jet speed and maintaining a constant course, indicating advanced capabilities.
Other witnesses, including airport operations staff, observed the bright white light, estimated to be about 500 feet in diameter, maneuvering with speeds of up to 1,200 miles per hour.
Radar contact was maintained on the object for about 15 minutes, and it was reported to have traveled at an unprecedented speed of 1,200 miles per hour.
The sighting took place with restricted visibility due to haze, and personnel at multiple locations, including CAA Tower and airport, also observed the phenomenon.
The report involves a detailed questionnaire for the observer, including questions about the shape, behavior, and disappearance of the object.
sighted object: Multiple unidentified flying objects with disc-like shapes
witnesses: CIVILIAN, airport operations staff, and other personnel at the CAA Tower and airport
photographs: No photographs were included in the report
